description: From Latin lītigāre, present active infinitive of lītigō; which, in its turn, stems from lītem (“a quarrel”) + agō (“do, practice”).

verbs.description: litigate (third-person singular simple present litigates, present participle litigating, simple past and past participle litigated)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, construed with on) To go to law; to carry on a lawsuit.
(transitive, transferred sense) To dispute; to fight over.
examples: you can't keep litigating this same point!
